executive_summary: The growth of the residential real estate sector has improved the Mobile Storage Services industry's fortunes during the five years. The residential market is the industry's largest revenue source, with demand dependent on existing home sales and housing starts. The industry also benefited from corporate market growth, although COVID-19 and the skyrocket of interest rates have resulted in significant volatility. Nonetheless, industry-wide revenue has been increasing at a CAGR of 1.2% over the past five years, including an estimated 4.4% decrease in 2023, and is expected to total $11.3 billion in 2023. In the same year, profit is projected to decrease to 14.2%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Mobile storage services revenue has been increasing at a CAGR of 1.2% over the past five years and is projected to reach $11.3 billion through the end of 2023. This includes a 4.4% decline in 2023 alone, while profit will likely decrease to 14.2%.

Propelled by the growth of the housing market and growth in corporate spending, the industry performed well prior to the expansion in interest rates in 2022. Although the industry mainly serves the residential market, mobile storage companies also serve the retail and corporate markets. Demand from retail customers has largely returned as Americans have increased spending on consumer goods, cooling down some volatility amid expanded interest rates.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Oil prices impact mobile storage companies
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry's performance benefited from the collapse in oil prices at the outset of the five years. Nonetheless, high inflation accompanies extraordinarily high oil prices. High oil prices can encourage consumers to stop purchasing mobile storage services altogether because of high transportation costs, which will reduce

COVID-19 severely reoriented demand for businesses service, as the unprecedented governmental decision to limit economic activity resulted in the shuttering of offices. Many offices have continued to function remotely as the pandemic has dragged on into a third year and millions of Americans have looked to remain in their jobs remotely. Consequently, the office rental vacancy rate has skyrocketed.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Mobile storage service revenue is expected to increase at a CAGR of 4.8% over the next five years, reaching an estimated $14.3 billion through the end of 2028, while profit rises to 16.4%.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Commercial space will prop up industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite changes ushered by the pandemic to alter the nature of work, the office rental vacancy rate will decline, causing commercial demand to pick up. As operations expand, the number of companies and the employment rate will step up.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Housing market turbulence will cause volatility
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Housing is the industry's largest target market, and the housing market's demand for industry services relies on trends in existing home sales. The Federal Reserve will continue raising interest rates in response to the uptick in inflation, causing consumers to hold off on buying new homes.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profit will boost with consumer demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The number of companies will expand as a result of increased demand and rising revenue. As companies recover, employment will follow suit. With demand increasing and the world oil price decreasing, the average industry profit margin will increase, benefitting the industry.

industry_definition: This industry provides mobile self-storage services to consumers and commercial customers. This industry is different from the self-storage companies in the Storage and Warehouse Leasing industry (IBISWorld report 53113) in that companies provide customers with door-to-door pickup and delivery.

mixed_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level - medium - steady

key_trends: The industry has been quick to recovery spurred by economic growth
Demand from the residential market has been primarily driven by historically low interest rates
Industry profit has remained strong, although it declined due to the pandemic
As a result of increased demand and rising revenue, the industry will expand
The housing construction market is expected to remain strong, supporting industry demand
The mobile storage industry is dependent on trends in office remodeling projects
Demand from the downstream residential market has returned the industry to growth

market_segmentation.segment_description: The segment is divided into two categories: short-term rentals of one month or less and long-term rentals. US Census Bureau data shows that the average American moves more than 11 times throughout their life. Services demand is highly correlated with trends in existing home sales and remodeling activity, as consumers commonly require the services when transporting or storing belongings.

Construction, retail and industrial sectors make up the largest source of demand for the Mobile Storage Services industry. Demand from this market declined in 2020 on account of COVID-19. While residential demand bounced back quickly, commercial growth has been more limited as offices have remained remote for long periods since the onset of the pandemic. The declining unemployment rate and rising entry into the workforce will boost demand from commercial clients moving forward.

The segment is divided into two categories: short-term rentals of one month or less and long-term rentals. US Census Bureau data shows that the average American moves more than 11 times throughout their life. Services demand is highly correlated with trends in existing home sales and remodeling activity, as consumers commonly require the services when transporting or storing belongings.

Other groups that use mobile storage services include students and seasonal visitors who store goods for short periods. College students store books, desks and other belongings during summer and study abroad periods. Seasonal visitors store household items and recreational equipment during off-seasons.

products_and_services.product_description: Companies charge a flat fee for the delivery of the unit and an additional fee for when the item is picked up and redelivered to clients.

Rental periods for storage containers range from one to six months, with one-month rentals being the most common. Monthly rental fees for mobile storage are typically higher than regular self-storage fees, given its more labor-intensive nature, which results in a higher average markup. Storage containers typically average 5 feet by 7 feet by 8 feet, large enough to contain one room to one-and-a-half rooms' worth of furniture.

Storage companies typically sell a range of supplies to households and businesses, like boxes, hand trucks, furniture dollies, rope and furniture pads. Companies also derive revenue from selling locks and latch to customers for use with their storage units.

tier_1_suppliers: Truck, Trailer & Motor Home Manufacturing in the US
Forklift & Conveyor Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Within the residential market, households commonly use mobile storage services to conveniently transport household items. Demand for services relies on trends in existing home sales. Over the past five years, the housing market's expansion has benefited the industry, spurring demand for mobile storage services. Demand for mobile storage services also depends on trends in remodeling activity, as consumers commonly use industry facilities for temporary storage during home improvement projects. Furthermore, trends in apartment, condominium and other multifamily housing rentals are another important driver of demand.

Retail, wholesale and manufacturing business is another source of demand for the Mobile Storage Services industry. Companies provide furniture, equipment, transportation, storage and document storage. Demand for Mobile Storage Services depends on office remodeling projects, rental vacancies and business expansion trends. When the office vacancy rate is low, and businesses expand their presence by renting out more offices, the industry has greater demand for storage and moving services.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Imports and exports are not applicable because the Mobile Storage Services industry is composed of storage facilities that are physically located within the United States. For more information on industry operator activity and investment in overseas operations, please reference the Industry Globalization section of this report.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest percentage of establishments at around 35%, while its population percentage is around 20%. Florida is the most dominant state in the Southeast region, partly because of its high population density. PODS Enterprises LLC, the industry leader, is headquartered in Florida.

The West region has the second highest percentage of establishments at around 20%, followed by the Southwest region at around 15%. The region sustains population growth, which makes it a popular region for mobile storage service companies. The West is also home to major technology companies like Meta, Alphabet, Microsoft and Apple. These companies manage billions of files, some of which need to be in print, so there is high demand for document storage units in the region.

Texas accounts for most business service establishments within the Southwest region, mainly because of the state's large population. Mobile Mini Inc., another prominent company in the industry, is headquartered in Phoenix, AZ.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Department of Transportation has safety and fitness regulations for employees related to drug and alcohol testing and regulations governing the hours of operation.

regulations_points.regulation_title: MOTOR CARRIER SAFETY IMPROVEMENT ACT OF 1999
regulations_points.regulation_description: This law gives requirements that companies of commercial vehicles, like moving trucks, must follow. Drivers must have a license from only one state, be 21 and older, complete a physical examination every two years, have a minimum of 20/40 vision in each eye and must not be color blind. If a person with a commercial license loses their original driver's license, this law forces states to revoke their commercial qualifications.

In 2006, the EPA required that the amount of sulfur in diesel fuel be no greater than 15 ppm; this was enforced for all on-road vehicles by 2010; this made fuel costs and therefore transport more expensive for moving companies, so they had to alter their business structure to follow the regulation and stay profitable.

Companies in the industry are subject to labor regulations. These regulations cover occupational health and safety, wage, overtime and other employment issues involving state and federal government agencies.

Permit applications for storage facilities must be made to the Planning Commission within the city or state where the facility is located. Conditions for development can include or be influenced by district zoning laws, landscaping requirements, set-back distances from the street, manager's residential quarters, vehicle parking, aisle width, rental agreement laws, franchise laws and others.
Health and safety guidelines were established in 2020 amid COVID-19. Such guidelines advised temporary social distancing and ongoing additional sanitation measures within facilities.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Low assistance level which is increasing.
High competition level which is increasing.

factors_decreased_barrier.factor: Low globalization level which is increasing.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies compete based on price, quality of service, location and security. Pricing is one of the most important factors.
Companies compete with full-service movers, self-storage facilities, and short-term truck rental companies.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry is relatively fragmented, with the top four companies generating less than one-fifth of revenue.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Economies of Scale and Brand Recognition
concentration_points.concentration_description: Large companies can provide services at lower costs due to economies of scale, making it difficult for smaller companies to compete. Well-known brands have an advantage.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rising Interest Rates are Holding Back Profit
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit dropped during COVID-19, but industry demand rebounded as Americans began to relocate, particularly with the increased prevalence of remote work. The Federal Reserve has raised interest rates in response to high inflation in 2022 and 2023, causing demand in housing and commercial sectors to be slow, reducing mobile storage services demand.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGES ARE THE INDUSTRY'S HIGHEST COST
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage costs have increased over the past five years and are estimated to account for 35.8% of industry revenue in 2023. Labor expenses are higher for mobile storage services than self-storage facilities because the industry must hire employees for transporting, moving and unloading boxes and for customer service roles, security, sales, administration and management positions.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: FUEL PRICES HAVE PUSHED UP PURCHASE PRICES
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs have decreased over the past five years and are estimated to account for 4.7% of industry revenue in 2023. Typical spending on purchases includes office supplies, fuel and day-to-day maintenance required for running warehouse management systems. The world price of crude oil rose in 2021 alone amid the surge in global demand, increasing transport costs and subsequently industry purchases.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Mobile Storage Services industry has a low to moderate degree of capital intensity. In 2023, for every $1.00 spent on wages, the industry typically allocates $0.09 to capital investment. Capital investment is substantial for mobile storage services, given that companies must invest in land, storage facilities, trailers, truckers, forklifts, containers, security and computer equipment.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Economic fluctuations are a big factor
volatility_points.volatility_description: The behavior of indicators like per capita disposable income determines how much people can spend, impacting the level of activity in the housing and commercial sectors and therefore industry performance.

Interest rates influence whether businesses or households choose to move, which will determine demand for the industry. Interest rates for mortgages are expected to balloon over this next year as the Federal Reserve tries to combat inflation, causing industry revenue to dip.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Mobile Storage Services industry has had a moderate degree of technological change over the past decade. The primary technological innovations have centered on improving information technology systems to better coordinate mobile storage container leasing, sales and delivery. Furthermore, electronic tracking technology and other wireless supply chain technologies have been another key area of technological change over the past decade as companies use barcodes and radio-frequency identification (RFID) technology to convey tracking information, product movement and time in transit.

FAQs.question: Does your company lease primarily to consumers or businesses?
FAQs.answer: The Mobile Storage Services industry provides mobile self-storage to both individuals and businesses. Although residential customers comprise the majority of demand, commercial operators are also a significant market.

FAQs.question: What, if any, portions of your business experience increased demand during periods of slow economic growth?
FAQs.answer: The Mobile Storage Services industry can benefit from both economic upturn and downturn. During periods of downturn, people need to temporarily store household goods while they downsize homes or rent smaller apartments to save money.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in locations with well-established, dynamic commercial markets?
FAQs.answer: Mobile storage operators seek locations with above-average population growth and income levels, such as high-density metropolitan areas. Smaller companies that operate in highly sought-after areas are likely acquisition candidates for larger companies looking to expand.

FAQs.question: How much does your company spend on advertising annually? Do you know how his compares to your competitors?
FAQs.answer: In 2018, the average mobile storage operator spends an estimated 1.8% of total revenue on advertising costs. As operators attempt to gain an advantage in the increasingly competitive self-storage market, advertising and promotional costs have increased.

FAQs.question: How has your company leveraged online platforms to reduce reliance on in-house personnel?
FAQs.answer: Operators have sought to add value in an increasingly competitive market by offering online reservation and payment services.

FAQs.question: Have you successfully reduced wage payments through automation in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Wages as a percentage of revenue have risen over the past five years, despite the fact that operators have installed more automated technologies. Because of the mobile component of industry services, services are labor intensive.

FAQs.question: Is your company adequately prepared to adjust to changing environmental standards?
FAQs.answer: Owners of mobile storage companies are responsible for hazardous materials and contaminants stored on premises. This comes under various hazardous materials laws that prohibit the storage of dangerous items within mini warehouses.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interest?
FAQs.answer: The mobile storage industry is represented by a variety of associations, including the National Portable Storage Association (NPSA).

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: Industry profit is forecast to have risen from 10.8% in 2013 to an estimated 12.9% of revenue in 2018. Many operators have invested in laborsaving technologies that have helped limit wage costs and bolster profit margins in the long run.

FAQs.question: Do you have problems with tenants paying on time?
FAQs.answer: Oftentimes, storage owners are permitted to sell the possessions inside of the storage unit that has not been paid for. The auspices under which storage owners can sell these items and how much money they can keep from the sale can vary between states.

FAQs.question: What range does your company have in terms of viable operating area? Do you have a competitive pricing strategy?
FAQs.answer: Storage facilities need to be close to population centers to minimize transportation expenses.

FAQs.question: Do you have a strong reputation among customers? Have you had any problems with reliability in the past?
FAQs.answer: Mobile storage companies that have a good reputation for access, security and price are able to boost patronage.

FAQs.question: Are you able to leverage economies of scale? What is your budget for expanding operations?
FAQs.answer: Companies in this industry that can provide higher volumes of storage services with minimized costs can develop economies of scale and greater profit.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your revenue goes to fuel costs? How can you alter pricing in light of rising fuel prices to maximize profit?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators use trucks to transport storage containers. These trucks use diesel fuel, and crude oil is the largest component of diesel fuel. When the world price of crude oil rises, companies in the industry may have to raise costs to make up for the increased cost of fuel, which may decrease demand.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of rising income levels? Are you prepared to increase service when income levels are high?
FAQs.answer: Movements in disposable income affect household consumption of goods, which ultimately affects industry demand. Consumers store furniture, along with other purchased items, in mobile storage facilities. When consumers have more disposable income, they are able to spend more on items that may require storage.

FAQs.question: Do you keep track of existing home sales? How do you counteract decreases in existing home sales?
FAQs.answer: Consumers, which make up the largest market for the industry, often demand mobile storage services when they move. Similarly, when existing home sales increase, industry demand will likely rise because an increase in existing home sales is an indicator of people relocating.
